metadata.title: CVE-2023-52652 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: NTB:fix possible name leak in ntb_register_device() If device_register() failsin ntb_register_device(), the device name allocated by dev_set_name()should be freed. As per the comment in device_register(), callers shoulduse put_device() to give up the reference in the error path. So fix this bycalling put_device() in the error path so that the name can be freed inkobject_cleanup(). As a result of this, put_device() in the error path ofntb_register_device() is removed and the actual error is returned. [mani:reworded commit message]

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52652` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-35-generic - 6.8.0-35.35
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-35-generic - 6.8.0-35.35
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-35-generic-64k - 6.8.0-35.35
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1009-aws - 6.8.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-azure - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-gcp - 6.8.0-1008.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1004-gke - 6.8.0-1004.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1006-ibm - 6.8.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-35-lowlatency - 6.8.0-35.35.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-35-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-35.35.1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1005-raspi - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1006-oem - 6.8.0-1006.6
No subscription required
